citation.article-title: Rudanella lutea gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from an air sample in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rudanella lutea sp. nov.
Rudanella lutea (lu′te.a. L. fem. adj. lutea orange-coloured).
Cells frequently form filaments that are 0.7–1 μm wide and 2.5–50 μm long.
Colonies are orange-coloured, convex and circular with clear margins after 3 days cultivation on R2A.
The pH range for growth is 6.0–9.0, with an optimum at pH 7.0.
The temperature range for growth is 5–40 °C, with an optimum at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at NaCl concentrations of 0–2 % (w/v).
Hydrolyses casein, tyrosine, Tween 80 and starch, but not chitin, CM-cellulose, DNA, hypoxanthine, pectin or xanthine.
In API 20NE test strips, cells are positive only for β-galactosidase.
Negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, aesculin hydrolysis and gelatin hydrolysis.
In API 20NE and API ID 32GN test strips, assimilates only glycogen.

In API ZYM tests, cells are positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-mannosidase.
Negative for lipase (C14), trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase and α-fucosidase.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 55 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, 5715S-11T (=KACC 12603T =DSM 19387T), was isolated from an air sample from Suwon City, Republic of Korea.
